title: Emmerdale spoilers: Robert is a killer as rapist Lee dies
text:
Robert Sugden’s (Ryan Hawley) has had plenty to deal with in Emmerdale as of late, what with him facing a prison sentence for what he did to Victoria Barton’s (Isabel Hodgins) rapist Lee, but there’s more heartache ahead for the young man, as — in the coming episodes — he learns the devastating news that Lee has died.

When Robert heard about what happened to Victoria, he decided to seek revenge on behalf of his sister — in spite of her consistently asking him not to — and, as a result, he went to great lengths to antagonise Lee. However, his erratic behaviour would ultimately come back to bite him as — unable to take Lee’s smug and arrogant demeanor any longer — he picked up a shovel and hit the rapist on the back of the head.

Victoria agreed to lie to the police to save her brother as she was under the pretence that Robert had simply acted in self-defence. However, upon learning that his attack on Lee was rage-driven and deliberate, Vic was understandably upset. Nonetheless, she agreed to stick by him, but Robert ended up pleading guilty to save his sister having to lie in court.

Since then, he’s enjoyed spending what free time he’s got left with husband Aaron (Danny Miller), but the coming episodes will see the young man dealt another devastating blow. After learning the earth-shattering news that her rapist has died, Victoria arrives at Robert and Aaron’s cottage to inform her brother.

Lee’s death will undoubtedly mean that Robert will be charged with murder — which means that, despite his guilty plea, he’s looking at having to serve a much longer sentence in prison.

Ryan Hawley said: ‘It’s shocking, it comes out of nowhere. Victoria comes and says Lee has died and they very quickly start to process what the implications will mean for Robert’s sentencing. He’s pled guilty already to GBH with intent, section 18, which will inevitably mean he will now be guilty or he thinks he will be found guilty fo the murder of Lee Posner.’

How will Robert react to this news?

What’s more, what will it mean for his future with Aaron?
